Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2013 11:23AM Isellrejer wrote: My mammograms have shown calcifications for over 4 years never any change. 6 months ago they started doing more pictures that are magnified and sonograms as I have heterogeneously dense breasts. The radiologist at the breast specialist gave me a bi-rads 3 six months ago. This month I went again for another mammogram with the extra magnified pictures. Same breast specialist now the radiologist says the calcifications have started multiplying and they are pleomorphic clusters that are more prominent. Bi-rads 4b. I cannot have the stereotactic biopsy so they are going to do an excisional biopsy on me. I am scared right now. Anyone else that has went through this?
Posts.Title: Pleomorphic Calcifications mommyalways Isellrejer
